definitions.definition: the last meal of the day, either a main meal, usually smaller and less formal than dinner, or a snack eaten before you go to bed

examples.text: I'll do my homework after supper.
We'll have an early supper tonight.
They invited me over for a bit of supper.
Let's talk about it over supper.
It can also be eaten as a supper dish with a salad.
There was always a harvest supper for the farm workers after the hay and wheat had been cut.
There'll be a potluck supper Sunday night at the church.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French super ‘to sup’ (used as a noun), of Germanic origin.
